questions.text: Antigen presenting cells (APC) express with MHC molecules?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

All cells except RBC express MHC I in addition antigen presenting cells express MHC II

questions.text: Birbeck granules are seen in
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Langerhan cell histiocytosis shows Birbeck granules which will appear as tennis raquet shaped inclusions on electron microscopy

questions.text: A chronic smoker has been diagnosed on lung cancer. The tumor is positive for P40. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 P40 is a tumour marker for squamous cell carcinoma of lung

questions.text: Which of the following has led to the appearance given in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Function of protein C is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

protein C induces lysis of factor 5 with the help of protein s thus acting as physiological anticoagulant.

questions.text: Most common organ for distant metastasis is ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Lungs. Lungs > bones >liver are common sites of metastasis

questions.text: Compounds A is arachidonic acid metabolites not inhibited by aspirin which inhibits Chemotaxis. Compound A is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 LX A4. The compound is not inhibited by aspirin indicates it is a lipoxygenase pathway metabolite which are lipoxin and leukotrienes. Inhibition of chemotaxis [inflammation] is done by lipoxin A4 and B4.

questions.text: Electron microscopy of a muscle in a patient presenting with weakness and fatigue is as follows. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

typical parking lot appearance seen in mitochondrial myopathy.

questions.text: TRALI occurs within what time of transfusion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 6 hours. TRALI is defined as acute lung injury (ARDS) occurring within 6 hrs of transfusion in absence of any precipitating cardiac or respiratory illness

questions.text:
Bone marrow aspirate of a patient is as follows. True about the disease is?

I. Patient might have DIC as a complication

II. It is poor prognostic

III. T (15;17) can be seen in this case

IV. This patient is having a chronic myeloid leukaemia

V. Cytarabine and Daunorubicin are first line of treatment in this patient
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

i,iii are true. The image shows large cells (blasts) containing abundant Auer-rods, which is suggestive of acute promyelocytic leukaemia. Which usually shows t(15;17) and treatment is All transretinoic acid with arsenic trioxide. It is a good prognostic aml.

questions.text: HPV produce the following oncogene which phosphorylates RB to cause carcinoma
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

E7. 16 and 18 are variants of virus not oncogenes. E6 causes proteolysis of p53 and E7 causes phosphorylation of RB.

questions.text: A 2 year girl is having recurrent hemarthrosis, hematoma and APTT is increased while PT is normal. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

patient has isolated elevated APTT only options A and D cause this in the options. The patient is a girl child thus Hemophilia A is unlikely ( since it is X linked recessive disease) thus Von Willebrand disease. Severe VwD will have reduced factor VIII levels leading to increase in APTT.

questions.text: Histological examination of a gastric tumour shows spindle cells which are positive for CD 117. What is the treatment ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 imatinib. Spindle cell tumour from stomach positive for CD 117 is diagnostic of GIST, tyrosine kinase inhibitor is drug of choice in GIST

questions.text: T (11;22) is seen in which malignancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 t(11;22) or EWS;FLI-1 translocation is seen in Ewings/ PNET

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of exfoliative cytology?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 PAP smears. Exfoliative cytology is a process where cells being exfoliated naturally are collected and screened for diseases(mostle for malignant or premalignant conditions Eg: PAP smears, urine cytology, Bronchioalveolar lavage & Sputum cytology

choices.text: All transretinoic acid is treatment for this disease
This patient is having an aplastic anemia
This patient is having a peripheral B cell neoplasm
Bortezomib is one of the drugs to be included in treatment of this case

questions.text: A 53-year-old presents with easy fatigue, repeated sinopulmonary infections for last few months. Clinical examination shows spleen is enlarged and no lymphnodes are palpable. CBC shows Hb9g/dL, TLC 3000/cu.mm, platelet count 39,000/cu.mm Peripheral blood smear was done and is as shown in the image. Which of the following is true about this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)
It is a peripheral B cell neoplasm. The blood smear shows cells with hair like projections suggesting diagnosis of hairy cell leukaemia, which is a peripheral B cells neoplasm. Option A is used in AML M3 (promyelocytic), option D is used in multiple myeloma. It is not option B because aplastic anaemia do not have splenomegaly

questions.text: Which of the following caspase is involved in mitochondrial pathway of apoptosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Caspase 9--> Intrinsic (mitochonrial) pathway, Caspase 3--> execution of pathway, Caspase 8 &10--> extrinsic pathway, Caspase 1-= Pyroptosis

questions.text: A 43-year-old presents with abdominal pain, nausea vomiting diarrrhea and weightloss of 6 kg in the past 4 weeks. A biopsy from intestine was done and is as shown in the image. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Whipple Disease. The image shows macrophages in lamina propria which is characteristic of Whipple disease. WD presents with extra intestinal manifestations like arthralgia, neurological involvement and usually extra intestinal manifestations precede the intestinal manifestations

questions.text: Which of the following testicular germ cell tumor is not derived from germ cell neoplasia insitu (GCNIS)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

spermatocytic tumor, prepubertal teratoma and prepubertal yolk sac tumors are germ cell tumors not derived from GCNIS

questions.text: A newborn has increased umbilical cord bleeding, prothrombin time and activated partial thromboplastin time are increased. Platelet count is normal. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 increased umbilical cord bleeding in newborn with PT and aPTT is feature of vitamin K deficiency. In option b &c both PT and aptt will be normal, in options d  TT will be elevated, and platelet count will be low

questions.text: A 5 year child has purpura joint pain and hematuria after a respiratory illness . Urine examination shows RBC casts. Which of the following is expected in him ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

This child has  henoch Schonlien purpura. Option A is seen in Wegners granulomatosis option D in mPAN option B in PAN

questions.text: True about celiac disease are all except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 reversal of changes after gluten free diet is diagnostic of celiac disease.

questions.text: A 46-year-old chronic smoker presents with cough, intermittent fever for many weeks. Now he also complains of recent onset of hoarseness of voice, cough. He has lost 6 kg after the onset of the symptoms. On chest X ray showed calcified lung lesion with few hilar lymphadenopathy. Serum calcium levels are increased. A biopsy from the lung is as below what is the likely treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Steroids.  The lesion shows discrete noncaseating granulomas suggestive of sarcoidosis. Further hypercalcemia is seen in sarcoidosis (due to increased Vitamin D) is in favour of sarcoid rather than tuberculosis

questions.text: Most important for pathogenesis of hypertensive aneurysms is ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hypertension leads to narrowing of lumen of vessels including vasa VAS prim due to either hyaline or hyperplastic arteriosclerosis

questions.text: Histological examination of a CNS tumor in a young patient is as follows. Which of the following genes causes such an inherited tumor ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

NF 2. Image shows psammoma bodies this with CNS tumor makes it meningioma which along with Schwannoma is associated with NF2

choices.text: Inability to arrest the cell cycle at G1S

questions.text: A 52-year-old man is diagnosed of CML. Cytogenetic analysis of cells obtained via bone marrow aspiration reveals a t(9:22) translocation. Which of the following cellular mechanism would lead to neoplasm in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 t9;22 leads to a new fusion protein which codes for tyrosine kinase thus leading to neoplasm.

questions.text: True about sirtuins are all except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Sirtuins are increased in calorie restriction which leads to increased longitivity.

choices.text: Sex cord stromal tumors of ovary

questions.text: In addition to multiple adenomatous polyps Turcot syndrome has which of the following mostly?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Turcot syndrome is FAP+ medulloblastoma, gardner syndrome is FAP + dermoid and epidermoid cysts+ osteomas.

questions.text: Clear cell carcinoma of ovaries are classified under
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Surface epithelial tumors

questions.text: Which of the following can be seen ARDS lung ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 In ARDS there will be damage of both type 1 and 2 pneumocyte, hyaline membrane and  compensatory hyperplasia of type 2 pneumocyte

questions.text: Testing for which bacteria is done before blood transfusion ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

in blood transfusion syphillis (treponema Palladium) is tested before transfusion. Although plasmodium (malaria) is tested it is a parasite not bacteria

questions.text: One week after injection of rituximab a patient of non-Hodgkin lymphoma develops haematuria, purpura, Lymphadenopathy and conjunctival erythema. Which of the following is most likely mechanism for the same?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 type 3 hypersensitivity, this patient has developed serum sickness reaction due to antibodies which is type 3 hypersensitivity.

questions.text: Gross examination of a salivary gland tumour is as follows what is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

gross examination shows a solid and cystic tumour with papillary projections characteristic of warthin tumour which is also known as papillary cyst adenoma lymphomatosum

questions.text: In iron excessive state liver produces protein A which decreases protein B in the intestine. Proteins A and B are respectively?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

hepcidin is produced by liver when stores are full which decreases ferroportin in the intestine thus leading mucosal block of iron.

questions.text: Particle size (in microns) that usually doesn’t leads to pneumoconiosis is ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

More than five doesn’t reach lungs thus less likely, size <1 are soluble thus processed as antigens and will lead to acute injury thus not causing pneumoconiosis

questions.text: On histological examination a plasma cells lies within a macrophage giving rise to cell in cell appearance. This phenomenon is known as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Emperipolesis.

questions.text: Fever is caused by?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

PGE2. PGE2, IL-1 and TNF alpha re endogenous pyrogens. Lipopolysaccharides are exogenous pyrogens

questions.text: False about synovial sarcoma is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

synovial sarcoma is a malignancy of unknown cell origin.

questions.text: Amniocentesis was done suspecting a chromosomal abnormality, which genetic test is appropriate
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

For chromosomal abnormality karyotype should be first investigation followed by FISH for confirmation

questions.text: True about clear cell Renal cell carcinoma are all except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Good prognosis. Clear C cell RCC have poor prognosis

questions.text:
True statements about graft rejection are
I. Chronic graft rejection is most common type of rejection
II. Polyoma virus causes owl eye inclusions in the tubular cells
III. Immuno supressives won’t be able to control hyper acute rejection
IV. Tubulitis is microscopic finding in acute humoral rejection
V. ABO matching is more important than HLA for kidney transplant
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: Bone marrow aspirate from a 4-year-old suffering with high grade fever and pancytopenia is as follows. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Image shows large cells [blast] with scant a granular cytoplasm suggestive of lymphoblast, further age is in favour of ALL

questions.text: Maximum number of times a human somatic cell Can multiply is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 60. The maximum number of times human cells can multiply is 50 to 70 is due to shortening of chromosomes after every cell division, this is called hey flix limit.

questions.text: A software engineer presents to opd with c/o easy fatigue.  He gives a history of sitting in front of computer for 12-14 hours per day. He takes more junk food and less fruits and veggies. CBC findings are hb-9gm% , mcv -120 what is most likely cause of anemia due to deficiency of?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Folic acid, the patient is clearly having a macrocytic anemia ( MCV 120) and not eating fruits and vegggies which are source of folic acid thus answer folic acid.

questions.text: Match the folllowing
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

choices.text: They trap Neutrophils in the tissue
They are made up of DNA
They are made up of bactericidal enzymes

questions.text: True about Neutrophil extracellular traps are all except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

NET trap bacteria not neutrophils.

questions.text: True about Bombay blood group is /are
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All

questions.text: NESTROFT test is used in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Naked eye single tube red cell osmotic fragility test is used as community screening test for thalassemia minors.

questions.text:
Which of the following is true about wound healing?
I. Type 3 collagen is predominant in first 3 weeks
II. Staphylococcus is the most common infection in surgical wound
III. Ratio of type 1 to type 3 collagen is 4:1 at 3 months
IV. Neutrophils are the first cell to arrive at the site of wound healing
V. Primary healing have less scar than secondary healing
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 I,II,III,V are true

choices.text: I-E, II- D, III- B, IV –A

questions.text: Match the following
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 I-C, II-A, III-B, IV-E

questions.text: Panacinar emphysema is associated with?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

pneumonia mostly lead to irregular emphysema smoking leads to centriacinar emphysema.

questions.text: Patient with general fatigue, tiredness, primary clinical examination is uneventful. Normal TLC and DLC. No immature cells seen. Superficial discrete lymph nodes enlarged. On biopsy showed effaced architecture, indented nucleus, prominent nucleolus containing atypical cells. CD 20, CD10 and BCL2 positive
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 Follicular lymphoma. Np fever weighloss or nightsweats in a patient suspected of lymphoma suggests a low grade option B and C are high grade thus ruled out. And it is CD 20 positive means a B cell lymphoma, Mycosis fungoides is a T cell lymphoma thus not the answer. So answer is follicular lymphoma.

questions.text: True about Xeroderma pigmentosa is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Squamous cell carcinoma is associated. Xeroderma pigmentosa is Nucleotide repair defect and is inherited in autosomal recessive pattern is associated with Squamous cell carcinoma of Skin Basal cell carcinoma and melanomas of Skin and Eyes

questions.text: Pneumococcal organisms are mostly killed in the body by which of the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Opsonisation. Capsulated organisms are killed by opsonisation and phagocytosis

questions.text: True about XIST is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

lnc RNA. Xist is a lnc RNA which helps in inactivation of chromosome X in females leading to bar body.

choices.text: I, II, III, IV are correct
I, III, IV, V are correct

questions.text:
True about cell injury is 
I. Increased intracellular Na
II. Decreased intracellular H+
III. Increased intracellular Ca+2
IV. Decreased intracellular ATP
V. Decreased intracellular pH
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 in cell injury there is increased intracellular NA, Ca H+ and decreased ATP and pH of cell.

questions.text: Most radio sensitive phase of cell cycle is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

G2. The following are in decreasing order of radio sensitivity G2>M>G1>S

questions.text: Match the following conditions with their causative proteins
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: True about autosomal recessive diseases are all except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

reduced penetrance can be seen. Reduced penetrance and variable expressivity r features of dominant diseases not recessive.

questions.text: Replacement of one base pair by another leading to same amino acid in genetics is known as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

silent mutation

questions.text: A 30 years-old male patient presents with anterior neck swelling. Microscopic image is given as following. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Lymphoid follicle formation in background of follicles is seen in Hashimoto.

choices.text: HER2 neu oncogene mutation is seen in gastric carcinoma
Deletion of protooncogene leads to tumor
RAS is the most common Protooncogene mutation in tumors

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about oncogenes?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Deletion leads to loss of function which is a feature of tumor supressor gene mutations.

questions.text: A patient is being transfused blood and develops sudden breathlessness and hypoxia. BP is 150/90. Which of the following investigations will help in arriving at diagnosis of transfusion associated circulatory overload?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

BNP. BNP will be increased in TACO, while decreased or normal in TRALI.

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman presents with a diffuse scaly skin rash of 4 weeks duration. Biopsy of lesional skin reveals mycosis fungoides. Which of the following IHC markers would be most useful for identifying malignant cells in the skin of this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Mycosis fungoides cutaneous T cell lymphoma à CD 3 positive

questions.text: At autopsy the heart of 82-year-old man is smaller and weighs less. Which of the following is likely possibility?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Lipofuscin accumulation, small heart in old age is suggestive of brown atrophy, which is due to lipofuscin accumulation

choices.text: Decreased ATP production per glucose molecule
Rapid biosynthesis of macromolecules for cell growth

questions.text: The metabolic advantage provided by the Warburg effect in cancer cells includes:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The advantages of Warburg effect is synthesis of molecules like Nucleic acid, aminoacids required for cell growth.

questions.text: What is the hallmark finding on electron microscopy in membranous nephropathy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Subepithelial deposits.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man with a history of smoking and hypertension presents with chest pain during exertion. CT angio shows 70% block in LAD. Which of the following is the earliest pathological change in the arterial wall in in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Endothelial cell injury. The clinical history is of atherosclerosis and earliest event in atherosclerosis is endothelial injury.

questions.text:
Which of the following conditions is associated with microcytic anemia, a low MCV, and low serum iron levels?
(1) Iron deficiency anemia
(2) Pyridoxin deficiency anemia
(3) Anemia of chronic disease
(4) Thalassemia minor
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

serum iron is low in both IDA and anemia of chronic disease.

questions.text: A 55-year-old patient with atherosclerosis develops calcification of plaques. What type of calcification is this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Dystrophic

questions.text: A 44-year-old man in acute distress is noted to have multiple ecchymoses of the skin that have developed over the past 48 hours. His prothrombin time (PT) is 38 seconds and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) 55 seconds. A CBC shows a WBC count of 5300/microliter, hemoglobin 8.1 g/dL, hematocrit 24.9%, MCV 99 fL, and platelet count 16,300/microliter. His D-Dimer test is very high. Which of the following is the most likely treatment in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Fresh frozen plasma. The patient is havig elevated PT and APTT with increased D-dimers is diagnostic of a disseminated intravascular coagulation, which requires replenishment of all coagulation factors and platelet thus platelet and FFP transfusion are main stay of treatment

questions.text: Identify the instrument
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 there is no side guard (screw) thus Kilma needle. Side guard is seen in Salah needle

questions.text: A healthy couple has a child diagnosed phenylketonuria (PKU), an autosomal recessive disorder. What is the probability that both parents are carriers?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

if child is having an autosomal recessive disorder, then both the parents have be carriers.

questions.text: A patient is requiring FFP transfusion and the slide agglutination for blood group is as follows. Which FFP can be safely transfused?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

The blood group based on the slide image is O, who is the universal recipient for FFP

questions.text: Which of the following is characteristic of transudate in edema?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Transudates are ultrafiltrate of plasma contain low protein, low Sp gravity and no inflammatory cells

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with rapidly worsening renal function, hematuria, and oliguria. Urinalysis shows RBC casts. Renal biopsy reveals crescents in >50% of glomeruli. Immunofluorescence shows no deposits? What is likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Microscopic polyangiitis being a pauci immune glomerulonephritis show no deposit.  GPS being a type II HSR shows linear deposits, immune complex deposits along BM will show granular deposits, disease where immune complexes are deposited in mesangium show mesangial deposits. PAN doesnot cause glomerulonephritis.

questions.text: All of the following are markers of lymphoblasts except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

CD19. CD19 is a marker of B cell lineage not lymphoblasts

questions.text: Match the following events in ischemic heart diseases
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: A 31-year-old woman has developed easy bruisability, even with minor trauma, to her skin over the past month. On physical examination she has multiple contusions of varying ages seen over her torso and extremities. She has no difficulty with movement. Rest of examination is normal. Her PT and PTT are normal. Her Hgb is 13.3 g/dL with Hct 42.1% and MCV 95 fL, platelet count 25,000/microliter, and WBC count is 7500/microliter. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Immune thrombocytopenic purpura. A chronic ITP occurs in adult females, associated with autoimmune diseases, present with thrombocytopenia and absence of splenomegaly.

questions.text: Which of the following test detects type 2 hypersensitivity?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

coombs test. It detects antibodies in the circulation or bound to the RBC which is as a result of immune hemolytic anemias [type 2 hypersensitivity]

questions.text: Histology of an ovarian tumor is as follows, likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 the image shows Schiller duval bodies which is seen in yolk sac (endodermal sinus) tumor.

questions.text: Given below is methylene blue stain of peripheral blood smear of a patient. The cell marked is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A deep incised skin wound heals itself by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Secondary intention. Anyone which is larger and deep will have edge separated thus will heal by secondary intention

questions.text: Which of the following is a key protein in the epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 EMT is on of the first steps required in cancer invasion, in this the tumor cells lose cadherins thus they loosen out which is induced by SNAIL and TWIST genes.

choices.text: It is a Direct coombs test
It prevents sensitisation to non ABO antigens
It reduces reactions from preexisting antibodies

questions.text: Which of the following is most appropriate about cross matching in blood transfusion
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cross matching is indirect Coombs test in which patients serum are tested against Donor RBC and it dectect preexisting antibodies (ABO or non ABO antigens)

questions.text: If a mother is affected by an X-linked dominant disorder, what is the likelihood of his daughter inheriting the disorder?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 in XLD father to son transmission is 0 and father to daughter is 100%, while mother to children transmission is 50% (to each).

questions.text: FNAC of paraaortic mass in a 10-year-old child with fever and weight loss is as follows. Which of the following marker best fits into this case
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Electron microscopy on lung biopsy is as follows, the structures marked with arrow are?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

the image shows type II pneumocyte and the marked structures are lamellar bodies which are surfactant containing bodies within type II pneumocyte.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT part of Virchow’s triad?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Gross examination of liver is as follows what condition is likely to lead to this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

the image shows characteristic nutmeg liver which is due to chronic venous congestion of liver (seen in hepatic vein obstruction and right sided heart failure.

questions.text: A 35-year-old female on imaging shows well circumscribed tumor with a central scar. Serum AFP is not elevated. There is no history of any chronic liver disease. Histology is as shown below what is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Radiology shows central scar and histology shows polygonal cells with dense fibrosis which is characteristic of fibrolamellar HCC.

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents with fever, fatigue, and generalized lymphadenopathy. Peripheral smear shows lymphoblasts. What genetic abnormality is associated with poor prognosis in ALL?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 poor prognostic genetics are Hypoploidy, Monosomy, T(1;19), t(4;11) and t(9;22)

questions.text: Histological examination of breast tumor is as follows, likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 the image shows Indian file pattern which is characteristic of lobular carcinoma.

questions.text: Histological examination of myocardial infarction is as follows, likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 image shows coagulative necrosis (loss of nuclei) with dense neutrophilic infiltrate the approximate age is 1-3 days

questions.text: Flow cytometry in a patient with LAD would reveal which abnormality?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Absence of CD18. LAD is due to deficiency of integrin molecules most commonly CD18.

questions.text:
Patient was diagnosed of folic acid deficiency anemia; he was started on oral folate which of the following is true about this
(1) Anemia doesn’t correct due to folate trap
(2) Neurological manifestation precipitate
(3) Anemia gets corrected
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 if only folate is given to patients with folic acid deficiency then anemia gets corrected but neuropathy precipitates.

questions.text: A patient with an obstructed ureter develops hydropic swelling of renal tubular cells. The underlying mechanism is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

sodium pump failure. Hydropic swelling is dilated endoplasmic reticulum due to retention of sodium and water which is in turn due to failure of sodium pump.

questions.text: Crystals of rinke are seen in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text:
Which of the following people cannot be donating blood?
(1) Homosexuals
(2) Chronic alcoholics
(3) History of malaria 2 months back
(4) History of blood transfusion 4 months back
(5) History of nose piercing 4 months back
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Electron microscopy of kidney in a patient suffering from hematuria is as follows. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

the EM shows dense deposits along the BM characteristic of Dense deposit disease (type II MPGN)

choices.text: Small wart like vegetations along lines of closure of valve
Commissural fusion of the aortic valve leaflets
Small vegetations on either surface of the valve

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman has had worsening malaise along with a malar skin rash persisting for 3 weeks. On physical examination, she has an audible friction rub on auscultation of the chest, along with a faint systolic murmur. Laboratory studies show a positive serologic test for anti-Smith antibody. An echocardiogram is likely to reveal which of the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 Small vegetations on either surface of the valve. The patient is having a SLE, with endocarditis (Libmann-Sach endocarditis) the vegetations are on either surface of the valve.

questions.text: Which disease follows the pattern of inheritance shown in this image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

the image shows mother to children 100% transmission and father to children 0% transmission thus it is mitochondrial inheritance.

questions.text: Which of the following bone disease occurs due to deficient osteoclasts?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Osteopetrosis (marble bone disease) occurs due to deficient osteoclast which leads to excessive mineralisation of bone.

questions.text: Blood smear of a patient presenting with anemia and recurrent infection is as follows. What is most likely etiology?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

the smear shows Rouleux formation of RBC which is characteristically seen in multiple myeloma.

questions.text: Which cytokine is essential for granuloma formation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

IFN-gamma. Granuloma formation includes activation of macrophages and infiltration by t cells which is done by interferon gamma. Tnf alpha induces chemotaxis of macrophages.

questions.text: Factor V Leiden mutation increases the risk of thrombosis because it causes resistance to:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Familial Lobular breast carcinomas are associated with
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

CDH1.

questions.text: Which of the following RBC index doesn’t change in anemia due to acute blood loss
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

MCV. Anemia of acute blood loss are normocytic anemia.

questions.text: Which of the following diseases leads to changes in the heart as shown below?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 the image shows concentric hypertrophy due to

questions.text: A 14-year-old boy presents with pain and swelling over his left femur for 3 months. He has been experiencing night sweats and low-grade fever. X-ray of the femur reveals a lytic lesion with an "onion-skin" periosteal reaction. A biopsy is performed and is shown as below. Immunohistochemistry shows strong membranous CD99 positivity, what is likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 small round cell tumor with CD99 positivity is diagnostic of Ewings sarcoma.

questions.text: Which Starling force is responsible for reabsorption of fluid into capillaries?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

capillary hydrostatic pressure pushes the water out of vessels (capillaries) and plasma oncotic pressure being a negative pressure draws water back into the venules.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man presents with hematuria, flank pain, and a palpable abdominal mass. Imaging reveals a renal mass histology is as below. Which is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Clear cell renal cell carcinoma. The histology shows clear cells with thin cytoplasmic borders characteristic of CRCC

questions.text: Given below are three oxygen dissociation curves, which of the following is true about these?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Storage of blood in blood bank reduces 23 DPG thus O2 dissociation curve shifts to left. ACD has height shift to left addition of phosphate (CPD) increased 23DPG thus curve shifts slightly to right.

questions.text: Histological examination of gastric tumor is as follows, which of the following mutations are likely seen in tumor
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

CDH1. The image shows signet ring cell adenocarcinoma which is seen in diffuse gastric carcinoma which shows CDH1 mutation leading to loss of E cadherin.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the Karyotype given under?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

normal female. There are two sex chromosomes (last pair) and all other chromosomes are normal in count.

questions.text: A 70-year-old male presents with fatigue and lymphadenopathy. CBC shows lymphocytosis, and flow cytometry reveals CD20, CD5 and CD23 positivity. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

CD 5 and Cd23 positive is characteristic of CLL

questions.text: Histological examination of lung biopsy of a neonate as follows, what is the marked structure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

hyaline membrane

questions.text: A patient presents with tinnitus and bodily imbalance; imaging shows a CP angle tumor. Histology is as below likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 the image shows hypocellular (Antoni B areas on right) and hypercellular (Antoni A areas on right) characteristic of Schwannoma

choices.text: Host T cells attacking donor cells
Donor T cells attacking host tissues

questions.text: A 40-year-old male underwent a bone marrow transplant for leukemia. He develops a maculopapular rash, diarrhea, and abnormal liver function tests one month later. Which cells are responsible for the pathology in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 the patient has developed Graft versus host disease, which is due to donor T cell attacking host tissue.

questions.text: A 30-year-old man with fracture of femur was started on prophylactic warfarin as he was going to be immobilised. 2 days later he presents with dark discoloration and necrosis of the skin. Which of the following has led to such a manifestation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Warfarin inhibits vitamin K dependent factors [2, 7, 9, 10, protein c and s] out of these factor 7 and protein C have very short T1/2 thus there is a risk of depletion of protein C whenever warfarin is started which leads to thrombosis and skin infarction. To prevent this restart the patient on heparin and later on switch to warfarin.

questions.text: A Patient diagnosed of aortic regurgitation has developed Changes in the heart secondary to his condition which of the following is it likely to be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Aortic regurgitation will lead to volume overload to the left ventricle which leads to eccentric hypertrophy.

questions.text: Characteristic mutation seen in Oligodendrogliomas is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Primary purpose of irradiation of blood product is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

irradiation kills WBC in the blood which are primarily responsible for GVHD.

questions.text: Histological examination of myocardium in a 22-year-old athlete who suffered an attack of angina is as follows. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

the muscle shows myocyte disarray and branching characteristically seen in HOCM.

questions.text: Special stain for demonstrating collagen in the tissue is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Which of the following disease occurs due to deficiency in the RBC membrane protein leading to increased complement mediated hemolysis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

spherocytosis is cytoskeletal protein defect while PNH is due to deficiency of Membrane protein.

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman has urinary frequency with dysuria for the past 4 days. On physical examination she has no flank pain or tenderness. A urinalysis reveals sp. gr. 1.014, pH 7.5, no glucose, no protein, no blood, nitrite positive, and many WBC's. She has a serum creatinine of 0.9 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The patient is having increased urination and WBC in urine suggests an inflammatory condition. Nitrate positive suggests it is an infectious condition and no WBC casts rules out option A. thus option B. option C is a chronic infectious condition of bladder (not acute)

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about diapedesis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Diapedesis occurs in venules except in lungs where it occurs in capillaries.

questions.text: A patient presents with easy fatigue, examination shows hepatosplenmegaly. CBC shows Hb 9, TLC 3000, platelet 30000. Bone marrow aspirate yields no cells. Which of the following is unlikely cause such presentation
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

the patient has pancytopenia with hepatosplenomegaly and dry tap on BMA. aplastic anemia doesnot cause hepatosplenomegaly.

questions.text:
Histology of pleomorphic adenoma shows.
(1) Cartilage
(2) Myxoid tissue
(3) Lymphoid tissue
(4) Squamous epithelium
(5) Glands
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pleomorphic adenoma is also known benign mixed tumor which shows mesenchymal elements like myxoid tissue, cartilage, bone and epithelial elements squamous cells, glands.

questions.text: Anaplasia refers to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 anaplasia is lack or loss of differentiation (poorly differentiated).

questions.text: A 53-year-old chronic smoker presents with 10kg weight loss in last 4 weeks, he complains of reduced appetite and physically appears to be wasted. A CT lung showed a mass in the periphery of the lung. Which of the following mechanism best explains the manifestation in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 excessive production of TNF. The patient is having a cancer cachexia which is due to TNF, which is called as cachexin

questions.text: A 45-year-old obese woman presents with sudden onset dyspnea, pleuritic chest pain, and hemoptysis. She underwent surgery for a fractured tibia 3 weeks back. Examination reveals tachycardia and decreased oxygen saturation. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

3 weeks after surgery to lower limb (immobilisation) leads to thromboembolism.

questions.text: A cell observed under 10X objective lens in light microscopy the image gets amplified
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 in light microscopy the eye piece is 10X so total magnification is Objective X eyepiece magnification.

questions.text:
Which of the following abnormalities can be detected on FISH?
(1) Gene deletion
(2) Point mutation
(3) Monosomy
(4) Translocation
(5) Gene amplification
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Post transfusion sepsis is most commonly seen after which transfusion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 since platelets are stored at room temperature chance of bacterial growth is more likely thus most likely to be associated with post transfusion sepsis.

questions.text: A 2-year-old child with macroglossia, hypoglycaemia is having an abdominal mass. Imaging confirms a renal tumor. Genetics shows paternal disomy of chromosome 11. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Beckwith Widemann syndrome. BWS is associated with loss of maternal imprinting of WT2 gene (Chromsome 11p15) or paternal disomy of chromosome 11 leading to gain of fnction. Clinically it is characeterised by embryonal malignancies like Wilms tumor, hepatoblastoma, macroglossia, organomegaly, Neonatal hypoglycemia.

questions.text: A 45-year-old farmer presents with chronic cough, dyspnea, and fatigue. He reports worsening symptoms after spending time in his field, where he stores hay. High-resolution CT shows ground-glass opacities and centrilobular nodules. Lung biopsy is as given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 biopsy shows granuloma with giant cell can be seen in options A, B and D. history of worsening with exposure to hay is characteristic of hypersensitivity pneumonitis.

questions.text: A patient with iron overload (hemochromatosis) develops liver cirrhosis. The primary mechanism of injury involves:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Free radical generation. Iron being a transition metal takes part in Fenton reaction which leads to production of free radical.

questions.text: An asymptomatic patient has an M-spike of 3.5g/dL, Bone marrow aspirate shows 8% plasma cells which are lambda restricted. CRAB is negative. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Gross examination of kidney is as follows, likely cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 the image shows Flea bitten kidney which is seen in malignant hypertension

questions.text: Heinz bodies are composed of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Heinz bodies are seen in G6PD deficiency anemia which are oxidised hemoglobin.

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with fatigue, bone pain and weight loss, undergoes a bone marrow biopsy. Congo red staining is positive. What is the next best step in the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

elderly patient with bone pain and amyloidosis we are suspecting multiple myeloma thus protein electrophoresis will be helpful.

questions.text: Patient develops respiratory difficulty and wheezing after consuming over the counter aspirin for fever. Which of the following mediator is responsible for the same?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The patient has developed aspirin induced asthma which is due to increased in lipoxygenase activity leading to increased leukotriene production.

questions.text: Von hippel Lindau syndrome is frequently associated with
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

choices.text: Loss of suppression of cell proliferation

questions.text: In human carcinogenesis, tumor cells induce CTLA 4 molecules, the role of such molecules is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A patient presents with recurrent infections, fatigue. BMA shows cells as given below which account for 12% blasts. Genetic examination shows PML;RARA translocation. What is the treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

the diagnosis is acute promyelocytic leukaemia and treatment of choice is All trans retinoic acid (which is an active metabolite of vitamin A)

questions.text: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease is most likely associated with
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 centriacinar is associated with COPD because there is loss of elastin in terminal bronchioles, Pneumothorax is frequently seen paraseptal emphysema.

questions.text: A patient develops breathlessness, hypertension after 5 hours of blood transfusion. Auscultation reveals bilateral crepitations and decreased oxygen saturation. Likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

hypertension and breathlessness with decreased saturation are characteristic of TACO.

questions.text: The following mutatons are associated with papillary carcinoma of thyroid except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

PTEN, WRn and DICER are associated with familial Follicular carcinoma, RAS mutation is associated with sporadic follicular carcinoma. Rest three are associated with papillary carcinoma.

questions.text: Congenital Deficiency of Structures labelled 2 in the image leads to
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

structure 2 is GP Ib-IX, deficiency of which leads to BSS

questions.text: Marsh grading is used in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mash grading is used in histological diagnosis of celiac disease. It is as follows

questions.text: A 55-year-old man with myocardial infarction. What is the hallmark of this type of necrosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Intact architecture with eosinophilic cytoplasm. Myocardial infarction is an example for coagulative necrosis, option b is correct description of coagulative necrosis.

questions.text: A 35-year male has been passing frequent dark coloured urine for last one month. Now he has difficulty in moving his left upper limb. A CT brain shows a thrombus. Abdominal examination shows no organomegaly. A hemogram done shows Hb 8g%, MCV 70 MCH 25 peripheral blood smear showed microcytic hypochromic anemia platelet count of 55000/cu.mm. Serum ferritin is 20µg/l, Serum iron is 30µg/dl and TIBC is 350µg/dl. Urine examination confirms presence of haemoglobin. Which of the following investigation would most likely help to arrive at diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Flow cytometry. The patient is having thrombosis, thrombocytopenia and haemolytic anemia (hemoglobinuria) is suggestive of paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria, Flow cytometry is diagnostic of

questions.text:
Which of the following is the correct order of sequence of steps in healing by primary intention
(1) Epithelial regeneration
(2) Fibrin clot
(3) Collagen production
(4) Collagen destruction
(5) Neutrophilic infiltrate
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: You are suspecting a case of myeloid sarcoma, which investigation will confirm the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

myeloid sarcoma is extramedullary proliferation of AML blast. diagnostic investigation is biopsy from the suspected site followed by immunohistochemistry to confirm.

choices.text: Stimulate bone marrow to release more RBC
Supress BM to release less RBC

questions.text: A child presenting with recurrent infections, anemia and jaundice. Is being treated on multiple drugs and receives blood transfusion intermittently. Peripheral blood smear is as follows. What is the role of blood transfusion in this child?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 in Sickle cell and thalassemia blood transfusion leads to suppression of BM which results in less sickle cell production.

questions.text: MCH class II complex is composed of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 MHC class II is made of 1 alpha and 1 beta subunit.

questions.text: Given below is Thromboelastogram image, the label A is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

in the given image A refers to R value of TEG which is elevated in coagulation factor deficiency.

questions.text: Which of the following is not associated with MEN 2A
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

ganglioneuroma are associated with MEN 2B

questions.text: A 48-year-old male presents recurrent infections, jaundice and bloated abdomen. Clinical examination shows hepatosplenomegaly and ascites. An USG shows a thrombus is the hepatic vein, the liver is edematous. A blood examination shows HCT 52%, Hb 18.5g/dL, TLC 3000, platelet count 1.2L. which of the following investigations will not help in arriving at diagnosis of this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Portal venous pressure measurement. The patient is having HCT>49 is diagnostic of polycythemia. to diagnose a polycythemia vera (most likely in this because of splenomegaly) we need to measure Serum EPO levels, BM examination and JAK 2 mutation in erythroid cells

questions.text: Minimum blasts required to diagnose a case of acute lymphoblastic leukaemia is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

none. For ALL the requirement is increased blasts in the bone marrow which show characteristic markers no minimum % criteria is there.

questions.text:
Which of the following is correct chronological steps involved in polymerase chain reaction?
(1) Annealing
(2) Denaturation
(3) Extension
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Staging used in CLL is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Red cell aplasia is a para neoplastic manifestation of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

thymoma.

questions.text: A 2-year boy is presenting with jaundice and splenomegaly is diagnosed of alpha thalassemia based on HPLC. Presence of which hemoglobin would make you arrive at such a conclusion
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

alpha thalassemia disease presenting after birth are due to HbH (beta tetramers), Hb Bart will be seen in alphathalassemia which present as erythroblastosis fetalis. HbF is seen in beta thalassemia, HbS in sickle cell anemia.

questions.text: Histological examination of a lung tumor is as follows. Which of the following marker panel will best fit into this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

the histology shows an adenocarcinoma. Which will be positive for TTF-1, Napsin A and negative for P40, P63 and CK5/6 (squamous cell carcinoma markers)

questions.text: Anticoagulant used in grey tube that is used for blood glucose estimation is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: A 5-year-old child with abdominal distension and diarrhea undergoes a duodenal biopsy. Histology shows increased IELs, crypt hyperplasia, and partial villous atrophy. If untreated which malignancy can arise from this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 the history and biopsy findings suggest it is a celiac disease which can progress to Enteropathy associated t cell lymphoma.

questions.text: In an electron microscopy the following stain is used to enhance the electron dense and electron luscent areas
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Gluteraldehyde is fixative used in electron microscopy and uranyl nitrate is stain used.

choices.text: Systemic embolism from the left atrium

questions.text: A 50-year-old man with a history of patent foramen ovale presents with sudden-onset left-sided hemiplegia. Imaging reveals an embolic stroke. Workup for deep vein thrombosis is positive. Which of the following is the most likely mechanism of embolism in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 if there is a septal defect in heart the venous thrombi directly pass to left side without involving lungs this is paradoxical embolism.

choices.text: Explains pathogenesis of tumor suppressor genes
1 st hit is inherited in familial cancers

questions.text: True about Knudson’s two hit hypothesis are all except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Chance of inherited hit is 50% while environmental hit chance is 100%.

questions.text: This photograph shows a high-power view of an ovarian tumor from a 30-year-old woman who presented with abnormal uterine bleeding and abdominal pain. Which of the following is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Reproductive group + bleeding and pain + ovarian tumor + coffee bean nuclei à Granulosa cell tumor

questions.text: A new Single dose IV iron available in which 1000 mg IV iron is given in single dose is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Postulated cell of origin of osteoclastoma is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The postulated cell of origin of osteoclastoma is osteoblastic progenitor cells

questions.text: In the following TEG, graph A is normal which of the following graph B is most likely to be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

vitamin K deficiency. In the TEG the R value is increased, and MA is normal thus it is any factor deficiency. Vitamin K leads to 2, 7, 9, 10 factor deficiency.

questions.text: 65 year male presents with lymphadenopathy testicular swelling and ataxia. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 lymphoma . Both Hodgkin and non Hodgkin lymphoma can have cerebella’s ataxia as paraneoplastic syndrome

questions.text: Which of the following occurs due to paternal deletion of a maternally imprinted gene on chromosome 15
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes and hypertension undergoes renal biopsy for evaluation of chronic renal disease. The biopsy is shown in the image. What is the appropriate diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hyaline arteriolosclerosis is demonstrated by vessels (smallest arteries and arterioles) that are markedly thickened by the deposition of basement membrane material and accumulation of plasma proteins. Hyaline arteriolosclerosis is often seen in the elderly, but more advanced lesions are observed in persons with diabetes or long-standing hypertension. 
The other choices are incorrect because they are not diseases of arterioles. Kimmelstiel-Wilson disease (choice B) affects glomeruli in patients with diabetes mellitus

questions.text: Which of the following would precipitate the condition which is shown in the image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

high altitude. The image shows sickle cells and target cells seen in sickle cell anemia. Sickling is precipitated by deoxygenation/ hypoxia, thus high altitude.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of monodermal teratoma ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Struma ovari is a teratoma containing only thyroid tissue thus a monodermal teratoma

questions.text: Identify incorrectly marked structure
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 the image shows a villous of intestine there is brush border epithelium not cilia in GIT.

questions.text: Gastrectomy can lead to which of the following deficiencies?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Iron and B12. Acidic pH is required for convertion of ferric form of iron to ferrous form and stomach secretes intrinsic factor which is required for B12 absorption.

questions.text: Most common inherited severe bleeding disorder is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: The function and mechanism of action of thrombomodulin in normal hemostasis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

activation of protein C. anti thrombin production is stimulated by thrombin, and plasminogen activation is done by tissue plasminogen activatiors.

questions.text:
S-100 is positive in
1) Schwannoma
2) Ewings sarcoma
3) Melanoma
4) GIST
5) Langerhan cell histiocytosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A 15-year-old healthy girl is having episodic wheeze during winters, such episodes subside by taking inhalational drug SOS. Bronchoscopy shows redness in the bronchi, histology shows fibrosis and inflammation. These histological findings are due to action of?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

inflammation and fibrosis are features of late phase of asthma which is due to eosinophils

questions.text: Special stain used to demonstrate H Pylori in gastric biopsy is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Warthin starry is a silver stain used for H Pylori.

questions.text: A 62-year-old man has had back pain for the past 8 months. He subsequently died of Lobar pneumonia. An abdominal CT scan shows multiple lytic lesions of the vertebrae. On the day prior to death his serum urea nitrogen was 63 mg/dL with creatinine 7.1 mg/dL. A dipstick urinalysis was normal. At autopsy, microscopy of kidney is as below. Which of the following fndings are associated with this condition
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

An increased IgG levels. This patient is having a renal amyloidosis and multiple lytic lesions in vertebra is suggestive of multiple myeloma, which will have an elevated M protein (most commonly IgG)., option C is for Renal cell carcinoma (clearly no RCC is seen in this patient) option D is for Lupus and other autoimmune disease clearly no glomerulonephritis was seen and there is no prior history of the same

choices.text: Originate from CD20- germinal centre B cells
EBV is one of the etiologies

questions.text: Biopsy from cervical lymph node is a patient who had weight loss and lymphadenopathy is as follows. Not true about this condition
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A child presents with fever easy fatigue, purpura and hepatosplenomegaly, TLC 40000, Flow cytometry is as follows. what is likely treatment?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Peripheral smear of a patient is as follows. Which disease is associated with this?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: A patient has weight loss for many months now. Blood examination shows increased in immunoglobulins. Electrophoresis is as given below, BMA shows 5% plasma cells. Electrolytes, LFT, RFT are within normal limits. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A 32-year-old software engineer, vegetarian by diet undergoes annual health checkup CBC shows Hb 11, MCH 24, MCV 65, RBC count is 5.5 million. What should be done next
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A 2-year-old child suspected of a genetic disorder is diagnosed of Leukaemia. Karyotype is as given below. Likely diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Perivascular pseudorosettes are seen in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Which of the following parameter that can be detected on morphology cannot be detected on RBC indices
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Histological examination of thyroid is as follows what is likely diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Which of the following is luminal B type of breast carcinoma
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Which of the following is not used for Gleason Grading
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)
